title: A serif to match Interstate?
content:
Hi,

I’m currently designing an annual report, set in Interstate for both headings as well as body text. At the moment I’m looking for a serif typeface, maybe in italic to use for quotes, introduction texts and so on. If you have any thoughts on which serif that would work well as a delicate supplemant to Interstate, it would be very much appreciated.

 [‹ Universal Penman - What version?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007175742/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40991 "Go to previous forum topic") [What are your favorite Didone typefaces? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007175742/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41028 "Go to next forum topic")
author: John Erik

comments.content: I’d suggest you consider the serif font as the body text and interstate for quotes and intros. Interstate isn’t that easy on the eyes for running text.
I know of a situation where a book designer was using Interstate and the author objected that it was too heavy. The designer switched the text to Walbaum and kept Interstate for the title/headings.
